ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about the biology of arthropods, the theories surrounding their development, and about the most discussed papers in the field. I developed the skill of reading scientific papers as well as identifying the different anatomical parts of specific arthropods.
Amazing class took a lot away from it. Only thing is I wish it was just entomology but nonetheless was very informative about the biology behind insects and other arthropods!
Some good overall knowledge of insect anatomy and behavior. Lots of fun facts.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I consider myself a very positive person. However, I would have to be utterly delusional in order to find any strengths in this course. The lectures were severely lacking in engaging material. As an escape, at times, I would run off to the bathroom during lectures to clear my mind amidst the feeling of boredom that would overwhelm me if I stayed sat during the entire class. While I appreciate Professor Wells' kindness, she simply cannot maintain an audience's attention because she is constantly stuttering and switching from one thought to the other. I sincerely recommend that she practices her presentations ahead of time to avoid appearing as unprepared and mindless as she did this last semester with the aforementioned behavior. The material may be appealing to students who have a real interest in arthropods, but these lectures were so excruciating that they held the power to suck away my passion for Ecology. I hope that she can apply this constructive criticism to improve her instruction in future semesters so students can enjoy the course as much as she seems to enjoy teaching it.

Strengths: all the videos of bugs doing cool things! Marta must have scoured all of the nature documentaries ever to get these videos. they're super helpful for both understanding the content and just for being entertaining

Strengths: Interesting, fascinating subject with a lot of videos and exmaples to keep students engaged. 
Weaknesses: A little disorganized, professor gets mixed up frequently and often is not able to respond to student questions.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: DO NOT take this course thinking it is a Science gut. In fact, do not take it at all if you're not an Ecology major. The lectures will feel tediously long and monotonous to the point that you may lose all interest in the topics at hand.

Marta has a lot of enthusiasm, and if you're interested in learning about bugs, you will like the course! If you're taking it as a gut... definitely possible but the three midterms can be a lot. You will need to really know the material. But otherwise, there is no required work between classes which is nice.
Yeah it was awesome and so cool!
YES a must take class Marta is an amazing teacher.
Probably not, unfortunately. I LOVE insects, and I don't regret taking this class, but it's a little too disorganized and I personally found the teaching too confusing to recommend it to anyone else.
